title: Tom Brady’s Super Bowl LX neutrality strikes a nerve with Patriots fans
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tom Brady's neutrality on the Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup divided New England fans, sparking feelings of disappointment.
Nearly 700 Boston.com readers shared mixed reactions, ranging from upset to understanding, over Brady's lack of support for the Patriots.
Brady's new roles in broadcasting and Raiders ownership influenced his impartial stance, leading to varied fan responses.

title: Carlton Davis shares how Patriots will cover Offensive Player of the Year Jaxon Smith-Njigba in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will cover Jaxon Smith-Njigba in Super Bowl LX, as revealed by Carlton Davis.
Smith-Njigba, Offensive Player of the Year, led the NFL with 1,793 receiving yards this season.
Gonzalez limited elite receivers, including Tee Higgins and Zay Flowers, to minimal gains this season.

title: How Hopkinton’s theater community inspired one woman to run the Boston Marathon
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Carla Perrotta, from Lexington, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support the Hopkinton Center for the Arts.
After moving from the Midwest in 2016, the theater at HCA helped Perrotta feel at home in Boston.
Perrotta, a mother of four, praises the arts' importance and aims to inspire her daughters through her run.

title: Newton Jewish day school places teacher on leave amid investigation into alleged inappropriate touching
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Solomon Schechter Day School in Newton placed a teacher on leave after a child reported inappropriate touching and tested positive for an STI.
Multiple agencies, including the Newton Police and Middlesex County District Attorney's Office, are investigating the allegations against the teacher.
The teacher, represented by attorney Rachel Stroup, denies the allegations, and no criminal charges have been filed as of the latest update.

title: She’s running Boston in memory of her dad — and for families facing liver disease
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Renée Behrens, 42, from Niskayuna, NY, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of her late father.
Behrens aims to raise funds for the American Liver Foundation, inspired by her father's battle with liver disease.
Her father, a former cross-country runner, influenced her running journey, including her World Major Marathons participation.

title: ‘Maye Way, baby’: Drake Maye’s older brothers give him inspiring messages ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Drake Maye's older brothers sent him inspiring messages ahead of Super Bowl LX against the Seattle Seahawks.
In the Players' Tribune video, Luke, Cole, and Beau Maye encouraged Drake with advice and praised his dedication.
Drake Maye, Patriots quarterback, is the latest in his family of athletes with his father and brothers' notable sports achievements.

title: Norwell needlepoint shop gets boost from Ann Michael Maye’s post
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Greenhouse Needlepoint in Norwell saw increased business after Ann Michael Maye posted about its products on Instagram.
The shop's social media following grew 18% in a week following the post by the Patriots quarterback's wife.
Greenhouse Needlepoint managed demand by opening preorders and shipped 50 canvases within a week.

title: The most unforgettable Patriots Super Bowl moments fans still talk about
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Malcolm Butler's interception in Super Bowl XLIX against the Seahawks is a key memorable moment for Patriots fans.
The Patriots' comeback from a 28-3 deficit in Super Bowl LI against the Falcons is highly regarded by fans.
Super Bowl XXXVI marked a turning point for the Patriots, featuring a memorable win over the Rams and Vinatieri's kick.

title: Former Mass General employee’s anti-ICE video prompts response from hospital
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts General Hospital stated a former employee made an anti-ICE video, distancing itself from her actions.
The TikTok video features 'Christina' using a staff badge and criticizes U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
Mass General clarified the individual had not been part of the hospital for some time, emphasizing their inclusive values.

title: The unwritten rules of skiing and riding on a mountain, according to readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Readers share advice on mountain etiquette, emphasizing behavior on chairlifts, trails, and inside ski lodges.
Tips include avoiding loud music, clearing landing areas promptly, and not stopping in the middle of slopes.
Proper use of ski racks and avoiding excessive drinking on chairlifts are advised for a better lodge experience.
